Andorra.description: A tiny, independent principality situated between France and Spain in the Pyrenees mountains. It is known for its ski resorts and a tax-haven status that encourages duty-free shopping.
Andorra.climate: Alpine climate with cold, snowy winters and mild, pleasant summers.

United Kingdom.description: An island nation in northwestern Europe made up of England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland. It features historic castles, rolling countryside, and vibrant cities like London.
United Kingdom.climate: Temperate maritime climate with cool summers, mild winters, and frequent rainfall.

Russia.description: The largest country in the world, spanning Eastern Europe and Northern Asia. It offers diverse landscapes from the icy tundra to the historic splendor of Moscow and Saint Petersburg.
Russia.climate: Varies significantly, but generally continental with very cold winters and warm summers.

Hong Kong.description: A dynamic city and special administrative region of China known for its iconic skyline, bustling harbor, and fusion of Eastern and Western cultures.
Hong Kong.climate: Subtropical with hot, humid summers and mild, dry winters.

Mexico.description: A vibrant country in North America known for its rich history, ancient Mayan and Aztec ruins, stunning beaches, and world-renowned cuisine.
Mexico.climate: Varies from tropical to desert, generally warm and sunny year-round.

Finland.description: A Northern European nation bordering Scandinavia and Russia, famous for its pristine lakes, northern lights, and being the home of Santa Claus in Lapland.
Finland.climate: Cold temperate climate with long, snowy winters and short, mild summers.

Ireland.description: The 'Emerald Isle' is known for its lush green landscapes, ancient Celtic history, friendly pubs, and the dramatic coastline of the Wild Atlantic Way.
Ireland.climate: Temperate maritime climate, mild and humid with frequent rain showers.

Germany.description: A major European power known for its historic cities, fairytale castles, the Black Forest, and world-class beer culture.
Germany.climate: Temperate seasonal climate with moderate rainfall and distinct seasons.

Portugal.description: A coastal nation in Southern Europe known for its seafaring history, port wine, stunning Algarve beaches, and the historic charm of Lisbon and Porto.
Portugal.climate: Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild, rainy winters.

Japan.description: An island nation blending ancient traditions with futuristic technology, famous for its temples, mountains, and incredible culinary scene.
Japan.climate: Temperate with four distinct seasons; snowy in the north and subtropical in the south.

France.description: A global center for art, fashion, and gastronomy, featuring legendary landmarks like the Eiffel Tower and the sun-drenched French Riviera.
France.climate: Temperate with Mediterranean influences in the south and oceanic in the west.

Italy.description: Renowned for its art treasures, historic ruins like the Colosseum, and world-famous pizza and pasta across regions from Tuscany to Sicily.
Italy.climate: Mediterranean with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters.

Canada.description: A vast North American country with breathtaking natural beauty, from the Rocky Mountains to the Great Lakes and vibrant multicultural cities.
Canada.climate: Varies from temperate in the south to arctic in the north; cold winters and warm summers.

Australia.description: A massive island continent known for the Outback, the Great Barrier Reef, and unique wildlife like kangaroos and koalas.
Australia.climate: Generally arid to semi-arid, with temperate climates in the southeast and southwest.

South Korea.description: A tech-forward nation with a rich heritage, famous for its palaces, mountain temples, and global K-pop influence in cities like Seoul.
South Korea.climate: Temperate with four distinct seasons; cold winters and humid, hot summers.

Switzerland.description: A landlocked mountainous country in Central Europe, famous for the Alps, luxury watches, and high-quality cheese and chocolate.
Switzerland.climate: Temperate, but varies with altitude; snowy in the mountains and mild in the valleys.

Thailand.description: A Southeast Asian gem known for its ornate temples, tropical beaches, and vibrant street food culture in cities like Bangkok.
Thailand.climate: Tropical monsoon climate with hot, rainy, and cool seasons.

Brazil.description: A vast South American country known for its festive Carnival, the Amazon rainforest, and iconic beaches like Copacabana.
Brazil.climate: Mostly tropical, with a temperate climate in the southern regions.

Spain.description: A diverse European country known for its passion, tapas, historical architecture like the Alhambra, and sunny Costa del Sol.
Spain.climate: Mediterranean with hot, dry summers and mild winters.

USA.description: A diverse nation of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, known for iconic cities like NYC and natural wonders like the Grand Canyon.
USA.climate: Ranges from tropical in Florida to arctic in Alaska; mostly temperate.

Philippines.description: An archipelago of over 7,000 islands known for its incredible biodiversity, white sand beaches, and friendly, hospitable locals.
Philippines.climate: Tropical maritime climate; hot, humid, and prone to monsoons.

Vietnam.description: A country known for its bustling cities, serene landscapes like Ha Long Bay, and a world-class street food culture.
Vietnam.climate: Tropical in the south, monsoonal in the north; generally humid.

Greece.description: The cradle of Western civilization, featuring thousands of islands, ancient ruins like the Parthenon, and stunning blue-domed buildings.
Greece.climate: Mediterranean with hot, dry summers and mild, rainy winters.

Austria.description: A landlocked Alpine nation known for its imperial history, classical music, and world-renowned ski slopes.
Austria.climate: Temperate continental with cold winters and cool to warm summers.

Belgium.description: Famous for its medieval towns, Renaissance architecture, and as the headquarters of the EU and NATO.
Belgium.climate: Temperate maritime climate with mild winters and cool summers.

Czech Republic.description: A country in Central Europe known for its ornate castles, native beers, and the historic beauty of Prague.
Czech Republic.climate: Temperate continental with relatively hot summers and cold, cloudy winters.

Denmark.description: A Scandinavian country comprising the Jutland Peninsula and numerous islands, known for its high quality of life and design.
Denmark.climate: Temperate climate, mild and humid with frequent rainfall.

Norway.description: Famous for its deep coastal fjords, mountains, and the midnight sun; a paradise for outdoor enthusiasts.
Norway.climate: Temperate maritime along the coast; colder and more continental inland.

Sweden.description: A Scandinavian nation with thousands of coastal islands and inland lakes, along with vast boreal forests and glaciated mountains.
Sweden.climate: Temperate in the south, subarctic in the north; cold winters and mild summers.

Netherlands.description: Known for its flat landscape of canals, tulip fields, windmills, and cycling routes.
Netherlands.climate: Temperate maritime with cool summers and mild winters.

Iceland.description: A Nordic island nation defined by its dramatic landscape with volcanoes, geysers, hot springs, and lava fields.
Iceland.climate: Subpolar oceanic climate, cold and windy with frequent weather changes.

New Zealand.description: An island country in the southwestern Pacific Ocean, famous for its breathtaking landscapes and being the filming location for Middle-earth.
New Zealand.climate: Temperate maritime with sharp regional contrasts; mild temperatures year-round.

Singapore.description: A sunny, tropical island city-state in Southeast Asia, known for its cleanliness, efficiency, and melting pot of cultures.
Singapore.climate: Tropical rainforest climate, hot and humid with no distinct seasons.

Malaysia.description: A Southeast Asian country known for its beaches, rainforests, and a mix of Malay, Chinese, Indian, and European cultural influences.
Malaysia.climate: Equatorial climate, hot and humid year-round with monsoon seasons.

Indonesia.description: The world's largest archipelago, home to diverse ethnic groups, stunning volcanoes, and the spiritual heart of Bali.
Indonesia.climate: Tropical with two seasons: wet and dry; warm temperatures year-round.

India.description: A vast South Asian country with a diverse landscape from the Himalayas to the Indian Ocean coast, rich in history and spirituality.
India.climate: Varies from tropical in the south to temperate in the north; dominated by monsoons.
